conclusion: The problem involves predicting which container (D or E) the liquid will flow into after passing through baffles.

The image shows three starting points labeled A, B, and C at the top, and two containers labeled D and E at the bottom.
There are baffles of different colors (purple, grey, yellow, and brown) positioned between the starting points and the containers.
Stream A flows downward and hits the purple baffle, changing its direction to the right.
Stream B flows straight downward and meets the grey slanted baffle, which redirects it to the left.
Stream C flows straight downward without encountering any obstacles.

conclusion: Streams A and B combine and flow downward after being redirected by the grey slanted baffle.

conclusion: The combined flow of streams A and B is directed toward container D.

conclusion: Stream C flows directly into container E.
